Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class CardMarket

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.CardMarket
public class CardMarket
extends java.lang.Object
class that defines the cardMarket section

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    CardMarket()
    constructor for the class, it uses gson and 12 files for the creation of the matrix of cards.
    CardMarket​(java.lang.String tests)  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    DevelopmentCard BuyCard​(int id)
    method the composes the body of the buy a card action.
    int[][] cardMarketStatus()
    method that creates a matrix containing the id of the cards visible (and that can be bought) by the players
    void DeleteTwoCardsByColor​(int color)
    METHOD strictly used in the singlePlayer action made by the "bot" Lorenzo
    given a color (that the controller can take from the token) as an int, the method deletes the first 2 cards available in a deck of that given color, it handles all the cases, and throws an EndSoloGame Exception if the EndGameScenario is reached if not the method just deletes the 2 cards and end.
    DevelopmentCard findFirstCardOfDeck​(int color, int level)
    method that returns a pointer to the card on top of the deck selected. the method EXPECTS a correct level and color, and also expects a not-empty deck.
    DevelopmentCard getCardById​(int id)
    method that returns a card present in the Market, if the card it's not present throws an exception
    int[] getCost​(int id)
    method that returns A copy of the cost of the card (identified by the Id).
    DevelopmentCard[][][] getMatrixDevelopment()  
    boolean NoMoreCardsInLevelThree​(int color)
    very small method used for SinglePlayer for checking if the EndGameState is reached
    int NumberOfCardsInLevel​(int color, int level)
    method that returns the number of cards in a specified deck. the method will give a runtime error if the level or color is invalid
    void populate​(int lvl, int color, java.lang.String Source)
    populate is the method used by the constructor to populate a specific deck of the 12 that make the market.
    void PrintId()
    method used while testing, mainly for the shuffling test
    void Remove​(int id)
    method that given a card id it removes the card from the market (usually after being bought)
    void Remove​(DevelopmentCard removeThis)
    overload of the method Remove, in this method it has to be passed as a parameter the card being removed itself
    void shuffle()
    method used to shuffle all the decks, it uses the same shuffling algorithm as the MarketBoard class
    void SoloAction​(Color ColoreToken)
    method that is called to perform the action, it's just a selection for the real method, which is DeleteTwoCardsByColor. this method re-throws an Exception EndSoloGame that is thrown by the DeleteTwoCardsByColor method.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • CardMarket

      public CardMarket()
      constructor for the class, it uses gson and 12 files for the creation of the matrix of cards. Explanation on how the matrix is populated is explained in the "populate" method.

    • CardMarket

      public CardMarket​(java.lang.String tests)

  • Method Details

    • getMatrixDevelopment

      public DevelopmentCard[][][] getMatrixDevelopment()

    • populate

      public void populate​(int lvl, int color, java.lang.String Source)
      populate is the method used by the constructor to populate a specific deck of the 12 that make the market.

      this method uses a simple gson deserialization to populate the specific deck, with the position of this deck given as a parameter via the level and color param.

      the path is given as a string.
      Parameters:
      lvl - is needed to find the right "row"
      color - is needed to find the right "column"
      Source - is the path of the JSON file that contains the 4 cards needed

    • shuffle

      public void shuffle()
      method used to shuffle all the decks, it uses the same shuffling algorithm as the MarketBoard class

    • Remove

      public void Remove​(int id)
      method that given a card id it removes the card from the market (usually after being bought)
      Parameters:
      id - is the id of the card being removed

    • Remove

      public void Remove​(DevelopmentCard removeThis)
      overload of the method Remove, in this method it has to be passed as a parameter the card being removed itself
      Parameters:
      removeThis - is the card being removed

    • PrintId

      public void PrintId()
      method used while testing, mainly for the shuffling test

    • getCardById

      public DevelopmentCard getCardById​(int id) throws CardNotFoundException
      method that returns a card present in the Market, if the card it's not present throws an exception
      Parameters:
      id - Id of the card searched
      Returns:
      card Found
      Throws:
      CardNotFoundException - card not found, throws Exception

    • getCost

      public int[] getCost​(int id)
      method that returns A copy of the cost of the card (identified by the Id). If the card is not present the method returns null.
      Parameters:
      id - id of the card searched
      Returns:
      cost of the card searched

    • BuyCard

      public DevelopmentCard BuyCard​(int id) throws CardNotFoundException, IllegalCardException
      method the composes the body of the buy a card action. This method returns the bought card, and removes it from the market. it throws a "CardNotFoundException" if the id of the card is not existent in the market, and throws an "IllegalCardException" if the card cannot be bought.
      Parameters:
      id - id of the card that is going to be bought
      Returns:
      The bought card
      Throws:
      CardNotFoundException - used when trying to buy a card not present in the market
      IllegalCardException - used when trying to buy a card not on top of its respective deck

    • SoloAction

      public void SoloAction​(Color ColoreToken) throws EndSoloGame
      method that is called to perform the action, it's just a selection for the real method, which is DeleteTwoCardsByColor. this method re-throws an Exception EndSoloGame that is thrown by the DeleteTwoCardsByColor method.
      Parameters:
      ColoreToken - color taken from the SoloActionToken
      Throws:
      EndSoloGame - Exception thrown by DeleteTwoCardsByColor, it's re-thrown to the controller.

    • DeleteTwoCardsByColor

      public void DeleteTwoCardsByColor​(int color) throws EndSoloGame
      METHOD strictly used in the singlePlayer action made by the "bot" Lorenzo
      given a color (that the controller can take from the token) as an int, the method deletes the first 2 cards available in a deck of that given color, it handles all the cases, and throws an EndSoloGame Exception if the EndGameScenario is reached if not the method just deletes the 2 cards and end.
      Parameters:
      color - color that the SoloActionToken returned
      Throws:
      EndSoloGame - in the scenario that an EndGameState is reached, an Exception for that is throwed

    • NumberOfCardsInLevel

      public int NumberOfCardsInLevel​(int color, int level)
      method that returns the number of cards in a specified deck. the method will give a runtime error if the level or color is invalid
      Parameters:
      color - color of the deck
      level - level of the deck (0-2)
      Returns:
      number of cards in the deck (0-4)

    • NoMoreCardsInLevelThree

      public boolean NoMoreCardsInLevelThree​(int color)
      very small method used for SinglePlayer for checking if the EndGameState is reached
      Parameters:
      color - color of the level 3 deck will be checked
      Returns:
      true if no more cards are present (EndGameState for singleP), false otherwise

    • findFirstCardOfDeck

      public DevelopmentCard findFirstCardOfDeck​(int color, int level) throws CardNotFoundException
      method that returns a pointer to the card on top of the deck selected. the method EXPECTS a correct level and color, and also expects a not-empty deck. If the deck is empty the method throws an Exception, if the color or level is not valid there will be an error at runtime
      Parameters:
      color - color selected, given as int
      level - level selected (0 to 2)
      Returns:
      pointer to the card selected
      Throws:
      CardNotFoundException - card not found

    • cardMarketStatus

      public int[][] cardMarketStatus()
      method that creates a matrix containing the id of the cards visible (and that can be bought) by the players
      Returns:
      id's of the cards available;
